page.title: 11Growing Hydroponic Tomatoes
page.content: There are two green houses covering {six thousand square metres.}The tomatoes are grown from seeds planted in{rockwool}and don't require soil but are grown in{well-oxygenated}running water.This is pumped round the plants in pipes from a tank which holds ten thousand litres.The water must not be hard and{acids}are added to make the PH number low.The plants are hung upon string, attached to a wire.No chemical insecticides are used.Instead they use a moth called{"Encasia"}which lays its eggs in White Fly eggs which the moth grubs then eat.The seeds are sown on October fifteenth and picking begins in February.A computer controls the heat of the greenhouses and checks the{weather}for wind temperature and ventilation.The computer also controls the{nutrients}and the acids which are added to the water.
